intro: Psychotria keralensis, commonly known as Keralan Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Psychotria keralensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
